title: Emory University Demonstration - April 25, 2024 (Atlanta Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any recording (including audio or video captured by body camera, vehicular camera, or handheld device) at Emory University on April 25, 2024. 

2. Any report concerning any arrest of or interaction with any demonstrator at or near Emory University on April 25, 2024.

3. Any communications to or from the Emory University administration, staff, or security officials on or after April 1, 2024.

4. Any communications to or from any elected official (including Gov. Brian Kemp, Lt. Gov. Burt Jones, any member of the Georgia legislature, or any Member of Congress) or any member of the staff (such as aides, secretaries, or assistants) of an elected official concerning Emory University or the April 25, 2024 demonstration at Emory University.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Ohio State University - April 25, 2024 demonstration (The Ohio State University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any recording (including audio or video captured by body camera, vehicular camera, or handheld device) of any interaction of law enforcement with demonstrators on the morning or afternoon of April 25, 2024. Please include all audio or video recorded during the interaction or within one hour after the interaction. 

2. Any report concerning any arrest of or interaction with any demonstrator on April 25, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any electronic communications between Larke Williams <williamsls@state.gov> and any email addresses with the domain name "@americanchemistry.com", which may include, but is not limited to, "ross_eisenberg@americanchemistry.com"

Please narrow by date, from February 1, 2022 to April 26, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nick
